title: Generate React Component
description: Creates a fully typed React component from a natural language description with props, state, and styling.
content:
Create a React component called [ComponentName] that [describe functionality]. Include:
- TypeScript types for all props
- Proper state management with useState/useReducer
- CSS modules or styled-components for styling
- Unit tests with React Testing Library
exampleOutput: Created UserCard.tsx with props interface, useState for loading state, and UserCard.module.css

title: Create REST API Endpoint
description: Scaffolds a complete REST API endpoint with validation, error handling, and tests.
content:
Create a REST API endpoint for [resource] with the following:
- HTTP method: [GET/POST/PUT/DELETE]
- Request validation using Zod or Joi
- Proper error handling with status codes
- Integration tests
- OpenAPI/Swagger documentation
exampleOutput: Created /api/users endpoint with POST handler, validation schema, and test file

title: Security-Focused PR Review
description: Reviews pull request changes for security vulnerabilities, injection risks, and auth issues.
content:
Review this PR for security issues. Check for:
- SQL/NoSQL injection vulnerabilities
- XSS and CSRF risks
- Authentication/authorization bypasses
- Sensitive data exposure
- Insecure dependencies
- Hardcoded secrets or credentials

Provide specific line references and remediation steps.
exampleOutput: Found 3 issues: SQL injection on line 45, missing CSRF token on form, exposed API key in config

title: Performance Optimization Review
description: Analyzes code for performance bottlenecks and suggests optimizations.
content:
Review this code for performance issues. Analyze:
- Time complexity of algorithms
- Memory usage and potential leaks
- Database query efficiency (N+1 problems)
- Unnecessary re-renders (React)
- Bundle size impact

Suggest specific optimizations with before/after examples.
exampleOutput: Found N+1 query in user loader. Suggested: Use DataLoader pattern to batch queries.

title: Analyze Error Stack Trace
description: Interprets error stack traces and identifies root cause with fix suggestions.
content:
Analyze this error stack trace and help me understand:
1. What is the root cause?
2. Which file/line is the actual source of the error?
3. What are possible fixes?
4. How can I prevent this in the future?

[Paste stack trace here]
exampleOutput: Root cause: Null reference at UserService.ts:23. The user object is undefined when accessed. Fix: Add null check before accessing user.email

title: Debug Failing Test
description: Investigates why a test is failing and provides targeted fixes.
content:
This test is failing: [test name]

Error message: [paste error]

Help me understand:
1. Why is this test failing?
2. Is it a test issue or a code issue?
3. What's the minimal fix?
4. Are there related tests that might also be affected?
exampleOutput: Test fails because mock doesn't match new API response shape. Update mock to include 'metadata' field.

title: Create Linear Issue from Code
description: Creates a Linear issue with context extracted from the current code file or error.
content:
Create a Linear issue for this problem:
- Extract relevant context from the current file
- Set appropriate priority based on severity
- Add relevant labels
- Link to the file/line in the repository
- Suggest an assignee based on git blame
exampleOutput: Created issue DEV-456: 'Fix null pointer in UserService' with High priority, assigned to @john

title: Generate README from Codebase
description: Analyzes the codebase and generates a comprehensive README with setup instructions.
content:
Analyze this codebase and generate a README.md that includes:
- Project description and purpose
- Tech stack and dependencies
- Installation and setup instructions
- Environment variables needed
- Available scripts/commands
- Project structure overview
- Contributing guidelines
exampleOutput: Generated README.md with 8 sections covering setup, usage, and contribution guidelines

title: Explain Complex Function
description: Provides a detailed explanation of what a function does, including edge cases.
content:
Explain this function in detail:
- What is its purpose?
- What are the inputs and outputs?
- What are the edge cases?
- Are there any side effects?
- What's the time/space complexity?
- How could it be improved?
exampleOutput: This function implements a debounced search. It delays API calls by 300ms to reduce server load...

title: Migrate Jest to Vitest
description: Automated migration from Jest to Vitest testing framework with config and test updates.
content:
Migrate this project from Jest to Vitest:
1. Update package.json dependencies
2. Create vitest.config.ts
3. Update test files to use Vitest syntax
4. Migrate Jest mocks to Vitest equivalents
5. Update CI/CD configuration
6. Run all tests to verify migration
exampleOutput: Migrated 45 test files, updated config, all 128 tests passing

title: Upgrade React 17 to 18
description: Handles React 18 upgrade including concurrent features and breaking changes.
content:
Upgrade this React 17 project to React 18:
1. Update react and react-dom packages
2. Migrate to createRoot API
3. Update TypeScript types
4. Fix StrictMode double-render issues
5. Identify components that need Suspense boundaries
6. Update testing utilities for React 18
7. Document any breaking changes found
exampleOutput: Upgraded to React 18.2, migrated 12 components, added 3 Suspense boundaries

title: Fix Vulnerable Dependencies
description: Identifies and fixes security vulnerabilities in project dependencies.
content:
Scan dependencies for security vulnerabilities and fix them:
1. Run npm audit / yarn audit
2. Identify high and critical vulnerabilities
3. Determine safe upgrade paths
4. Update dependencies with minimal breaking changes
5. Run tests to verify nothing broke
6. Document any manual interventions needed

title: Security Audit npm Packages
description: Performs deep security audit of npm packages including transitive dependencies.
content:
Perform a security audit of this project's npm packages:
1. Check for known CVEs in all dependencies
2. Identify packages with no recent updates (abandoned)
3. Flag packages with suspicious install scripts
4. Check for typosquatting risks
5. Review permissions requested by packages
6. Generate a security report with recommendations
exampleOutput: Audit complete: 2 critical CVEs, 3 abandoned packages, 1 suspicious postinstall script

title: Set Up CI/CD Pipeline
description: Creates a complete CI/CD pipeline with testing, linting, and deployment stages.
content:
Set up a CI/CD pipeline for this project:
1. Create GitHub Actions workflow (or GitLab CI/Jenkins)
2. Add linting and type-checking stage
3. Add unit and integration test stages
4. Add build stage with caching
5. Add deployment stage with environment variables
6. Configure branch protection rules
7. Add status badges to README
exampleOutput: Created .github/workflows/ci.yml with lint, test, build, and deploy stages

title: Create Pre-commit Hooks
description: Sets up pre-commit hooks for linting, formatting, and commit message validation.
content:
Set up pre-commit hooks using Husky and lint-staged:
1. Install husky and lint-staged
2. Configure pre-commit hook for linting
3. Configure pre-commit hook for formatting (Prettier)
4. Add commit message validation (Commitlint)
5. Add pre-push hook for tests
6. Document the hooks in README
exampleOutput: Installed husky, configured lint-staged for .ts/.tsx files, added commitlint
